title: Rehab Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was invited to do an interview for a casual position a few weeks later. It consisted of one panel interview with the manager & 3 other rehab team members. A mix of traditional questions, scenario (i.e. "tell me about a time"), and clinical questions.
Interview Questions: What specific skills and experiences do you have that will help you excel in this position?

title: Reseach Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network in Jul 2023
Interview Descriptions: interview is with the PI. Technical questions and reference checks are key. in person interview. describe your background while they talk about the project. Highly professional. Talk about masters/bachelors study and experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a hurdle you came across and how you overcame the same

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth, but the interviewer was late. They didn't ask a lot of questions. All the question was related to what I do in my graduate study. They were very friendly, and that eased up the whole process.
Interview Questions: Briefly describe your research field.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Through zoom because of Covid, but still engaging and the interviewers make you feel comfortable through the process. I prefer to be in person but under the circumstances I understood
Interview Questions: What about you sticks out compared to the rest of the candidates?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview with recruiter was pretty standard. Introduced myself. Recruiter explained what the role entailed. Asked about salary expectations. Recruiter asked approximately 3 behavioural questions. Was told that my resume would be forwarded to hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work with a difficult client.

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews; one recruiter general chat and one panel interview. In panel interview you will be given a topic 6 hours before to do a presentation. Friendly panel and it's more like a discussion than an interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave current role?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: One panel interview with manager, educator and staff nurse. Series of clinical related questions assessing nursing assessment skills - what is your understanding of the situation? How would you address these concerns? How would you follow up? Some questions on soft skills
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where you heard that a co-nurse was talking behind your back?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview questions. Depending on department, there is a mini test to evaluate your related skill. I wasn't interviewed by the manager at the time but usually they are present.
Interview Questions: What is a strength and weakness of yours?

title: EVS Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: phone interview about yourself pretty basic then in person where you go in and answer questions about avilabililty and senerio based then you wait a few weeks and theyll call you
Interview Questions: Your avilability for on call

title: EPIC Project Support Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied on UHN's recruiting site. I got an interview invitation after 2-3 weeks. There was only one round of interviews and there were 2 interviewers. I was asked behavioral-based questions. It was almost a 15-20 minutes interview.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell us about yourself. 2. What is your experience with phone-based customer service?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interview with an open atmosphere. Past experiences are an asset and it is important to know what skills are applicable with examples. Research the job well and also the person you are working for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self.

title: Hospital Porter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with an HR representative, then you get emailed into having an interview with the manager, then reference checks. Offer with the detail of your working conditions, compensation. etc
Interview Questions: How does this benefit you? Do you have experience with patients

title: Coop Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: it was an easy and comfortable process, I felt easy with the recruiter whose name was Rita and she asked questions related to my education and work experience. the questions were moderate level for these but other than that it was easy for me. I did get a response from them but then I had got a paid coop somewhere else and I pursued that instead.
Interview Questions: why do you want this position

title: Project Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my university and was interviewed by 2 people. The interview process was easy and quick, as it was for a school program (co-op). The interview lasted approximately 30 minutes and it only consisted of 3 questions.
Interview Questions: What is an important aspect of team culture?

title: Clinical Trial Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: easy multiple people attended very clear smart questions accommodating to your schedule asked about personal life asked about past experience multistep process 1 hour long met with doctors and nurses salary negotiation took two weeks
Interview Questions: how i will help my team in tough situations

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: easy, more like a conversation. However Interviewers seemed like they did not want to be there. ie, was not enthusiastic, seemed disinterested. Especially in a virtual setting, made it hard to communicate
Interview Questions: How long would you expect an offer for a promotion would take

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: 2 stage interview. 1st was traditional/behavioural questions you'd expect from most interviews and 2nd was panel case study on a sample Health/IT project. Overall response times were efficient and communication was clear.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Clinical Study and Regulatory Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: The interview took a little over an hour. There were some basic interview questions, practical questions, and a couple of on the spot assignments to do. More difficult than other interviews I have done.
Interview Questions: What does CAPA stand for?

title: Legal Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was relatively short, maybe a 15 minute interview. There were a few questions asked.  Some were in depth and some were short answer questions. Overall it was quite an enjoyable interview, and the interviewer was very polite. She did jot down notes of the things i said.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply here specifically?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. No assessment required.  Interviewers were great and the feedback was provided on that same day after the interview. Although the opportunity was of unpaid training. Usually interview is conducted online on MS teams
Interview Questions: Experience in research during studies

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Intereviewed by patient care coordinator and nurse manager. The interview process was around 40 minutes. I was shown around the unit. The interviewers were very warm which made the experience feel easier, although it was a standard interview.
Interview Questions: How do you believe your previous and current experience will impact your role as this type of nurse?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. The first interview is with your manager to get to know you, your goals and what your expectations are. The second interview is with the investigators and other crcs, nurses on the team to see how you fit with them
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviewers virtually , Each interviewer asks several questions and takes notes of answers.  Prescreening before second interview. Ask scenario based questions and skill set questions. Advice to honestly answer questions and ask to repeat questions if not understood well.
Interview Questions: How would you prepare for an audit?

title: Applications Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
1) You get a call from HR and they do an initial screening. They ask you what pay your seeking and will low ball you to take less. After that, you get the second interview.

2) Second Interview is with people who you will report too, Manager and Team Leads. Technical interview. The interview is 1 hour and it's boring and a waste of time. The interview I had with UHN was probably the worst interview I had in my career. The manager and team leads definitely have issues and I was interested in the job after doing the interview. The IT department needs a complete overhaul in my opinion. 

3) Hire Team Leads and Managers with people skills because they lack it severely. They need to take daily communication skill seminars. I feel bad for whoever has to report to them.
Interview Questions: Technical Questions. Scenario based questions.

title: RPN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2 panel interview. Got a call. They sent an email for an interview opportunity. Took about 30mins. 3 cases/situational questions. It was fair. Basic questions that nurses should know. Not too bad. Got an email by the end of the week
Interview Questions: Why chose nursing and why should we hire you?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: the interview was very well done. the questions were very easy. It felt more like a conversation. Very simple technical questions and few behavioural questions. Overall it was a very good experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Talk about technical projet

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2 round 1st hiring manager 2nd hiring manager and director. All through zoom. We’re polite and asked many questions about soft skills and working with others and new team members.
Interview Questions: Working with new ppl. Deadlines, expeditions

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was done virtually with 2 interviewers. The questions were mostly specific to the role. I got the feeling that they already had someone internally who was familiar with the role and knows what to do in specific instances. They didn't ask competency-related questions like... tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult situation etc. I followed up 2 times after the interview and neither interviewer responded to let me know I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the doctor's info is incorrect on the sample info form? What is another doctor is requesting info when they didn't submit the lab testing form?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
The job requirement was clearly stated. 
The interviewers were pretty friendly. The interview took about an hour and you would receive feedback at the end
The job requirement was clearly stated
Interview Questions: Related to the job statements

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Can do well if you prepare:
What would you do if pt had acute resp distress?
- What tests can you expect, possible dx for a patient that experienced resp distress
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via email to a post at Nature Magazine online job board. Was contacted by the hiring manager for references. References were submitted. Shortly after was invited to interview 1 with the PI and lab manager. then I was invited to present at the lab meeting and answer questions. later it was followed up by interviews with the lab members. in total about 7 meetings. went very well.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans building upon your previous postdoctoral experience in combination with the future experience you are looking to gain in this lab?

title: Project Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with two project managers, each with different projects on the go. - introduced their projects - gave more info about role - asked their questions - gave time for me to ask questions Total phone call was about 40 min
Interview Questions: Questions were situational and behavioral questions.

title: Technical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: Pass the resume screening

Step 2: Pass the phone screenings (1-2 rounds)

Step 3: Pass the on-site interviews (4-5 rounds)

Step 4: Pass the hiring committee reviews and get the offer
Interview Questions: How big is the earth?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Called for a phone screening shortly after submitting an application. Brought for a formal interview shortly after. Questions were a mix of behavioural and skills. Reference check at the end.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with multiple priorities

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview - more of a conversation. It depends on the department you're working with but mine was easy. General questions about prior work experience, capabilities, ability to write reviews, conduct research interviews, etc.
Interview Questions: What was my prior experience, ethics

title: At-The-Elbow Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: was great and smooth but they did take almost a month to get back to me after my interview which was stressful a b c d e f g h i
Interview Questions: time you dealt with a difficult person

title: Constant observer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: really easy- group interview everyone answers a question. Everyone got the chance to speak, it was on MS teams, very nice. It was about an hour long but some of it was showing us the schedule and question time from us
Interview Questions: Patient is being abused and you are starting shift... what do you do?

title: Hospital Support Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. First they introduced themselves and UHN, what it offers, the responsibilities for this job, etc. Then they asked a bunch of questions, and I included one just below
Interview Questions: How did you successfully interact with difficult boss, professor, or coworker

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager and colleague in person interview after scheduling with the administrative assistant.  Very straightforward. One interview only.  Offer extended shortly afterwards. It's a large organization so interviews may differ between departments
Interview Questions: When are you able to start?

title: Business Development Associate (BDA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Several rounds of interviews with the same stakeholders over a period of several months. Overall was very to the point with all details in place, confirmation email and who the individuals are so you can get informed on who they are.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had several deadlines and had to manage competing demands.

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I participated in two rounds of interviews, one more aligned with general qualifications for the role while the second interview included several job specific questions including a case study. The scenario was provided during the middle of the interview and I had 15 minutes to develop a high level project plan and next steps which was then presented back to the interview group.
Interview Questions: What has been an experience in which you had workplace conflict and how did you resolve it?

title: Registered Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Received a call for interview. In-person in-front of a panel of three person which included educator, manager and a charge nurse. Overall it was okay. Process did not take too long
Interview Questions: Did some case scenario, and typical type of nursing questions

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very kind people, took pressure off the interview process. Very straight forward interview, overall great experience and not intimidating. Interview contained 2 rounds, and the amount of time to hear back if you made it through to the second round was around a week.
Interview Questions:
What are some of your weaknesses?

Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple but hard to get in. Interview process was through zoom. panel of three or five. Simple and straight forward. But quiet difficult to get into UHN. Good luck  and stay positive
Interview Questions: Experience, educational background, how will you fit into this laboratory, etc.

title: Financial System Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Conducted an online interview with a small panel, 4 individuals who's team I would be joining. They were kind and professional. Primarily cultural fit questions and industry experience. The interview process last approximately an hour.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in working here?

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good , they have asked about your experience at your workplace ,manager tells about the role for the position , tells you patient chart are the most important., spelling and date of birth are key
Interview Questions: the interview questions were strength ,weakness , conflict

title: Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1 hr, 2 person. the director was overly formal, it was more of an interrogation than an interview. There was no small talk or rapport built, they just want to know what you can do. Most questions were technical
Interview Questions: What contracts have you negotiated? They want details, due to confidentiality i could not share much specifics

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was approx. 4 hours interview.  First, presentation and answer questions. Then individual interview with supervisor about past experience, projects, expectations, answer his question, etc.  Then meet all team members individually and discuss with them.
Interview Questions: What are steps used to analyze RNAseq data and why do you use each step? Explain how normalization is performed.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health Network in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was smooth and quick for coop roles. The interviewer made it very comfortable for me and responded to me in a timely manner. If I had any questions or concerns, they were quickly addresses. The TA team was a pleasure to work with as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about UHN

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was brief, the interviewer was very kind and patient even though I was super nervous. My interview was only 30 minutes so it wasn't very long. This was my first job interview so I did not know what to expect but overall it was a good experience
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a conflict with a colleague, how did you solve it?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interview rounds (3 in total, all panel style interviews with 5-6 staff members present and involved in asking questions). Interview was completed remotely via MS Teams in light of COVID-19 pandemic. Interview involved money practical questions involving application of hard and soft skills and demonstration of advanced knowledge of the industry.
Interview Questions: List some common audit findings and their implications on data quality?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick. I was contacted the same day I applied. The interview over video call was done within a few days and PI was more than helpful in connecting me with other scientist in the field.
Interview Questions: What is your long-term goal?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Interview in person with nursing educator, patient care coordinator, and nursing manager. Applied online, heard back within 3 weeks and contacted by manager to set up interview after applying on UHN's website.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a conflict and how you resolved it

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Interview with principle investigator, sub-investigator and Nurse practitioner.  They focus on describing the daily work at site and your soft skills.  They did not inform me about the result
Interview Questions: An example of multi tasking

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back from the manager and had the first round of interview with the manager and tech lead. The second round of interview was with the team.
Interview Questions:
How do you prioritize your tasks and tight deadlines?

Background/ research experience/ programming experience

title: Summer Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: They asked about my previous experience as well as my specialty. They then continued to describe their projects and which project would best suit my skill base and discuss it with me.
Interview Questions: Q: What experience do you have with developing large-scale projects?

title: Application Development Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process straight forward. First you get a phone screen and then invited for a panel interview with the senior and lead manager. Make sure you know UHN and the position inside out.
Interview Questions:
What do you want to work here ? 
How do you fit in this position ?

title: Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was on the phone and incredibly easy. I did bridging which means getting hired after a COOP. Probation period was also 180 working days so about 6 months which is a long time but you still have access to benefits
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress or any issues with coworkers/patients

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: just a zoom call to check past experience nothing too serious but did not get the job since I did not have some of the qualifications. Overall it wasn't easy to get selected for interview
Interview Questions: can you explain how western blot is done

title: Graduate Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Had a 2 hour video interview to talk about my previous research experience, career aspirations, and the projects/training the lab can offer; no technical questions. Was subsequently invited to the lab to meet other students and get an immersive experience in the day to day life at the lab.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this lab?

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was called without any warning for a quick phone screen. The interviewer seemed a bit disorganized and asked standard behavioural/fit questions. The next steps came down to salary expectations. I was told that the salary would be well beneath what was posted in the job description. The interviewer told me she would look into the higher end of the scale and get back to me, but I never heard from her after this call. The call seemed to go fairly smoothly otherwise.
Interview Questions: What are you most proud of (professional or personal)?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and a month later I  was first contacted for a Phone screening interview. I was then asked to come in for an in-person interview. The whole process took about 2 months
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job ?

title: Resident Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, very fast and straight to the point trainings online and in person virtual meeting with HR for information session background check vulnerable sector check references are very important!
Interview Questions: tell me about your skills

title: Human Resources Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: The process was straightforward and I enjoyed interviewing at UHN.  The panelists were friendly and provided information about the role.  They asked for my preferences for areas of interest, and used that information to make their decision.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. - all behavioural.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an interview invite about 1.5 months after. Zoom interview with 3 people. Interview questions included: Tell me about yourself, your relevant experience, communication skills that would help you succeed in this role, examples of leadership.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, your relevant experience, communication skills that would help you succeed in this role, examples of leadership.

title: PHP Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Phone call initial interview. Then called in for a panel interview. After passing that you get a coding project which you have to present much like a thesis defence. Then final interview.
Interview Questions: Technical question on PHP object oriented programming.

title: Health Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview panel with a mix of disciplines asking case based questions. Questions would give a variety of descriptors and add in Queries regarding teamwork, conflict resolutions, problem solving. Panel did not probe or ask you to expand so ensure you say enough. Very open to questions and happy to explain what they were looking for post interview. 

Cons - via ms but no camera, hard to interact
Interview Questions: After providing expectations of the role, How can you evolve the current role and what do you bring to the role that others don’t?

title: Senior Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Really lengthy! it will take over 4 weeks so be prepared to wait it out. I applied as a research analyst. all in all easy process, memorize ur resume and you will be gold.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, tell me about your resume.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: A scenario was provided to design the project roadmap/lifecycle from the kick-off meeting to going live. I had to prepare a presentation as per the provided scenario and present it during the interview in 5 -7 minutes. They did ask some clarification questions regarding some of the ideas introduced in my presentation. Then general leadership and management questions.
Interview Questions:
How you can connect back your recommended goals to the objectives?

What is your leadership style while managing a portfolio of projects with diverse teams?

Why this position and department?

Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?

How would you define project management?

title: HR Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online via website. 
Received phone call and did prescreen questions over the phone 
In-person interview, group interview. Questions were not hard - asked which area of interest for the placement. 
Completed health assessment tests and waited for offer. 
Onboard volunteer process 
Orientation 
Completed onboarding training online
Attended hospital orientation
Interview Questions: Good

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxing atmosphere, panel interviewees of three, mostly technical questions and some behavioral questions.  Got hired on the same day of interview, but had to negotiate with wage.
Interview Questions: Tell me an example of how you handled a conflict with a difficult co-worker

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Make sure to give examples. Was given a task to do and had to complete it during the interview. Make sure ur review the slides before hand. You will be sent the worksheet 30 mins prior.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Stem Cell Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very disorganized interview process. A manager (person of contact) organized my interviews with other managers but they were not prepared (late for a hour and cannot find their files and technical exams). Did not get a offer/rejection from the person of contact after asking for a reply/decision.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there is an equipment failure?

title: Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Started as a volunteer. After working as a research volunteer for less than a month I was interviewed for a full-time role as a research student. The interview involved a review of my resume to gauge my interest in reserach.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be involved in research?

title: Manager, Fundraising and Special Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email by HR. for first interview with two manager. Second interview was with different staff. The process was easy and the company did a good job to answer all my questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Tell me about yourself? RE knowledge

title: Clinical Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was conducted at first then got invited for a zoom interview with senior staff members. Basic questions were asked regarding job skills and experience. Good discussion. Very quick process. Good response time. Very happy.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process took 2  weeks. I applied online and they reached out to me a week later asking to arrange an interview. They were late for 20mins. They seemed to be careless about what I was saying.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient

title: Clinical Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute virtual screening interview with the primary investigator of the clinical trial. Basic questions were asked and a general overview of the role was provided. Overall a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with REB applications?

title: Decision Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Overall a very negative experience. The questions asked were unclear and the interviewer interrogated why a particular mark on your transcript is comparatively lower than the others. The conversation was not smooth and learned nothing about this job role. The interviewer was quite rude and arrogant.
Interview Questions: why a particular mark on your transcript is comparatively lower than the others

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I had to answer a questionnaire during the application process, then I got an email asking me for interview slots I would be available for. I was interviewed by a doctor. It was a simple process but it was a very difficult place to find in the hospital--I was late but she did take long with another interviewee so not really.

My issues are that the Dr acted as if I wasn't really qualified. I am. I was a perfect applicant as I had adjacent experience in a similar role for a major organization, it just wasn't healthcare. It was almost like she was suspicious of my interest in healthcare. I have a communications degree, we can work anywhere for communications roles, it's not unusual.

My main issue is that I never heard back from them. I asked the doctor during the interview when I should expect to hear back and she said more than a few weeks, then I asked the HR contact from the email two weeks later and she said once the Dr had made a decision. I basically waited for months and never heard back from them. I'm not sure if COVID had anything to do with the decision as I interviewed mid January, but I'm very disappointed I never heard back. It's disgusting to not give interviewees the respect of letting them know if they weren't selected, especially for such a major institution.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UHN?

title: Personal Support Work Psw Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Health Network in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: intense but good. overall an enlightening experience. alot of competition so we will see what happens.confidently answered all questions. hopefully years of experience will propel me to the top. i was informed it will take a week to hear back.
Interview Questions: what do i bring to the table?

title: Registered Physiotherapist Interview

title: RN Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, taking about 1.5 months to hear back about first and second interview + another 2 weeks for an offer. Originally applied for a job under a different name, however in the offer they changed the name of the position. Despite the long process, the interview was easy and standard in terms of questions. Second interview involved a computer competency test.

title: Finance Department Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
Received an email to do a pre-qualification exercise. After completing the exercise, I was scheduled for a panel interview.

Interview went great and got a phone call a week after telling me that the position will be offfered to me of I'm interested. I told them yes, and they'll follow up with a written offer.

Never heard back even when I tried to follow up through email and phone calls. No hard feelings, as I know this things happen. But seems to be very unprofessional and wouldn't have want to work for them anyways if this is the reflection of their department's culture.
Interview Questions: mixed of behavioral and technical questions

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I have been referred for this job. The interview was through Skype. It did not take long.  I should say that the interview for these kind of positions are different than interviews in industry.
Interview Questions: Since the PI that I was doing the interview knew my research beforehand, there was no technical questions. They asked about how long I think the project should take, and about my salary.

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: This was in the relatively newly funded research center. A panel interview of five. It was supposed to be less of a technical position and more of a data analyst one, based on their job description. However, their PI said that they wanted two persons in one (data engineer and data analyst). So, instead of 'accessing a data lake' (as described in their ad), they discussed how to 'build a data lake' and instead of 'preferred experience in medical coding/adoption of standards'  as mentioned in their ad, this became a solid requirement during the interview. Their Primary Investigator (PI), a relatively new scientist, spent the whole time working on his laptop. I knew that he was not doing anything relevant to the interview itself as he was sitting right next to me. He almost never made any eye contact, even when asking questions. I knew from the first minute that this cannot be good, and I have little to no chance, and I might as well leave, but decided to give it my best shot, anyway. Two of the panelists were positive, but they probably had little say. One panelist was apprehensive and changing her facial expression each time I was talking or moving, even though I was not saying anything weird. In summary, too many signs of prejudice.
Interview Questions: I described some of that above. Noticed that they asked me some questions that I already elaborated my expertise in, but because of not caring or paying attention to what I was saying, they did not notice that.

title: Registered Dietitian Interview

3 people interviewing me- manager, dietitian and SLP.

whole process lasted about 25 minutes

After the interview, I was asked to complete an online psychological test (which I didn't like very much), and then was asked for three references. It was generally a positive experience, and most importantly - i did not feel intimidated or too nervous. In retrospect, i wished i prepared more examples of success stories and work challenges, as well as solutions. Ragardless of the panel, there is still anxiety and hard to think of examples right away.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging situation/ conflict with another person and how you resolved it.

title: Summer Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The application process starts in an online portal through the department you are interested in - in my case it was the Department of Medical Biophysics. Following an application through this portal, you select a number of Principal Investigators that interest you. They will respond with interest if you meet their criteria. Be sure to have a keen understanding of the research that the PI does - you will be directly involved in their projects and under an Post Doc or PhD student working.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in my lab's work?

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of a single person interview with future boss which was then followed by an informal chat with future colleague who had been employed by the group for several months.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult, discusison of prior work experience.

title: Public Affairs Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received an e-mail to schedule me in for an interview, giving me plenty of time to prepare. Once I confirmed, I was sent all the details including the names on the interview panel and location. The interview was professional and efficient. Everyone took turns asking questions. I didn't get an offer but once they had hired, I received an e-mail to let me know. This is greatly appreciated.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with a panel of staffing advisors who were very welcoming. Each asked a series of questions. At the end, they would ask you which three departments you would prefer most. I got a call back on the same day for an offer. It's a very quick process after interviews.
Interview Questions: How will your skills and knowledge help you in this role/position

title: Technical Analyst Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was short and very basic interview. I felt like the interviewer had already made his mind to hire me. He was friendly and asking very basic IT questions. The interview ended in 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you commute to Toronto?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I had two interviews. First interview was a panel including the hiring manager and two assistant. The second interview was with the rest of the admin staff. 
The interviews were easy. The questions focused around how to get along with people and how to organize and prioritize.
It was a good experience and fast pace interview process. They called back consistently to schedule interviews.
I did not get the job but the experience was enjoyable.
Interview Questions: Skills in scheduling and dealing with priorities.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was telephone interview, HR called me from Princess Margaret Cancer Center. She asked me about my background and my soft skills. And also asked about submit for REB. Furthermore, she asked me why I want to work in Canada. She asked me everything about my clinical research experience.
Interview Questions: Have you submitted in REB?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was through co-op placement of my college, and so all arrangements were made through the college department. The interview consisted of the project manager, team lead and another developer, held in their meeting room. There was an enthusiastic introduction on their project, followed by questions from each of them. Possibly because of the level of the position, the questions were not very technical. Most of the interviewers were quite friendly.
Interview Questions: I was asked what some of my favourite tools were, as well as some basic questions on Html5.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone two weeks after I submitted my application. A 10' phone interview took place where basic HR questions were asked regarding my skills and qualifications. The phone interview was followed by a panel interview (of 3 persons) that took place 2 days later. Overall, the interview was very basic and easy. The questions were very typical such as: What do you know about Princess Margaret Hospital? Why did you apply for this job? What makes you better than other candidates? They also asked me about my technical skills and previous experience in detail. However, as soon as I stepped in the room, introduced myself and greeted all the three women, one of them asked me the following: 'Did you just came back from the gym?' in a unkind manner. Thankfully the comment and the expression didn't threw me off because I was confident in my appearance being business casual (dark blue dress pants, white blouse, minimal jewelry, my purse and a jacket which I was holding). I answered 'No I didn't' but I did knew that this interview was just a lost cause. It seems that this person ( who fired 75% of the questions) already had someone else in mind and I was there filling candidate quotas.
Interview Questions: What makes you a better candidate?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely lenghty.  Not very well organized. We were many candidates scheduled in one day and I was the third. I got to see the interviwers ~ 45 min later than scheduled.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was organized and pleasant.  It did not take long from the time that I applied to the interview and the hire.  It was a positive experience.  They confirmed appointments by email which is good.  Everyone was friendly.
Interview Questions: They have a set of standard questions.  I was asked about my ability to multitask and work independently.

title: SIMS, Business Analyst - Co-op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: In person behavioural interview with the hiring manager with a few questions about data analysis and specifics of projects. Was invited after the recommendation of one of the managers. My several years of working in managerial role did not convince the interviewer that I'm capable of doing "something myself". During the interview, the interviewer followed the script, rarely asking about details.
Interview Questions: Which role do you take on the team?

title: Clinical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I first went to an information session where my contact information was taken down. I then sent my resume via email, and was contacted to schedule an interview later on.
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you?

title: Learning Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with meeting the recruiter and we connected quite well and she felt that I was a great fit for the organization. I then met with a group of 5 individuals in a panel interview and was asked several questions. We developed a great relationship with the team and felt that the interview went extremely well.
Interview Questions: How do you solve problems?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interview, both in-person and 1 hr in length. All interviewers were very warm and friendly. First round felt like a chat rather than a formal interview. Second one is more serious, where I met the senior managers, and the topics were more focused on the skills/experiences relevant to the position. Both interviews used the same set of questions, so there was a bit of repetition. Overall, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What's your biggest accomplishment in your professional career?

title: Summer Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Meeting time was discussed in emails. Motivation questions were asked, so as background questions. I was also asked if I have former experience in labs. Several easy questions about lab techniques were also asked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in our lab?

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty okay, decent questions - nothing tricky at all. Just the usual behavioural scenarios that I was already expecting. I got a chance to meet with the team members,which really helped in my making the decision to accept the offer!
Interview Questions: Tell us where you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clinical Project Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University Health Network in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received a call during the week, and had a phone interview. She asked general interview questions and my why I would be a good candidate for the job. Afterwards she asked me to come in for an interview the following morning. There were two people doing the interview. Overall, they were really nice and it seemed like a warm environment. It lasted about 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of research specific situational questions, which i wasn't fully prepared for, but did my best to answer them.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communication was done via email. Interview was scheduled a week later. Interviewer was pleasant and friendly and tried to make me at ease. UHN has a very formal set-up but everyone, from the volunteers to the staff was very friendly. I'd gotten disoriented about the location and approached a number of staff to guide me and they did so readily. 
The whole interview lasted for about 45 minutes. There were standard questions and also situational  questions. 
Interviewer walked me through the door and also passed me her business cards without me asking. What a great environment for working andy volunteering
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was the situational question on what am I going to do if a man walked up to me and said that he had only a few months left to live.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and exactly after 10 days I  received an email, to schedule an interview even though on submission they said it may take up to 4 weeks . In email there was table with dates and various time slots options were give to choose one. Each time slot was of 30 min. I picked one that suited me most.
Interview Questions: The person / Lead who was suppose to take my interview was not even present, It was a very junior person who was taking my interview and was in a rush. She barely asked 4-5 question   It was not a pleasant experience for me. Simple questions tell us about your self.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was a one :one interview .It was only one interview with the hiring manager and research technologist , got offer in 3 weeks time. They have asked many behavioural questions. Some of the questions were like situations where you have to  describe with your personal experience.
Interview Questions: how would  you react if your colleague criticize your work?  Any situation where the staff under you doesn't cooperate with you.

title: Scientific Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews
Interview Questions: State top 3 strengths, where do you see yourself in 10 years.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: A few days after I submitted the online application I was contacted for the phone interview. Lasted about 10 minutes, with questions like "What skills do you have that are relevant to this job" and "why are you interested in this position". Had an interview the following week, and the interview itself was quite easy. Some behavioural questions, some scenarios, but all questions were relevant to the job and no trick questions.
Interview Questions: what would be your ideal manager like

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: After submitting online application, i got an interview call. It was easy. and two days later I got the job.
Interview Questions: I prepared for interview well. So, did not have any unexpected questions.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: the interview was scheduled over the phone first as I was not able to do the interview in-person. The in-person interview was later followed-up by an in-person interview. I was provided an offer over the phone and then received an offer via email.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your leadership experience

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview...not too bad. They asked easy questions and were polite throughout the process. They asked all the standard questions regarding education, work experience, volunteer experience. They also asked for a minimum of three references from past work places. Not sure if they ever contacted them.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have dealing with difficult people in the workplace?

title: Clinical Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Very lengthy and took very long. there were five different interviews and each were at least two weeks apart

The wait was a bit frustrating as decision making was really slow

Overall it took about six months from application submission to hiring
Interview Questions: Share experiences

title: Bio Statistician Co-op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
One interview scheduled one-on-one.

Questions were asked about resume, hobbies, job experience.

Skills questions followed.

Describe linear regression in layman's terms.

The interviewer was very pleasant, and overall a very positive experience. She did not ask any behavioural questions as the job was a very technical research-based one. However, she did ask skills questions that were quite straightforward. Did not get the interview, I stumbled a bit when she asked to describe linear regression from a non-statistical viewpoint.
Interview Questions: Question about logistic regression was asked - given the estimated coefficients from a logistic regression and the deviance measure with the degrees of freedom, analyze what the coefficient means in terms of effectiveness and whether or not the value is significant.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Hired directly after obtaining the PhD degree
Interview Questions: Hard to explain

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called by HR for a position at Princess Margaret Hospital. The options for interview times were very flexible. I set up the appointment and arrived 10 minutes early. There wasn't anyone at the front desk and I waited for half an hour to actually be acknowledged.  When the manager finally arrived, he informed me that we had to wait for one more person to join us. When the other person finally arrived I had been there for over an hour past my scheduled interview time. I already didn't want the job just based on how unorganized things were. I was asked 1 technical question, the rest of the questions were just useless (eg: biggest weakness, where you see yourself in 5 years). I ended up just cutting off the manager, telling him I wasn't interested in the job. He asked why and told him the reason. I found it to be a waste of time and don't recommend.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: .NET Developer Coop Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Regular interview questions, skills,  about the company, experience, college, time, project, current project, interest, traveling, relocation, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more,
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by two people and the experience was very un professional. They were contradictions within the panel themselves it was obvious there was some tension in the group. One of the members was litrally nasty and made me very uncomfortable. They gave me the job that I should not have taken.
Interview Questions: they wanted book answers

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager. Second interview with team. Mostly behaviour type questions. Very laid back. Didn't feel nervous. Also some lifting was required for the job so there was some test lifting of various weights and sizes. Lasted about an hour and was offered the job within a weeks time. No negotiating of salary.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioural questions. Describe a time when you were faced with a challenging situation.

title: Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I knew the doctor for whom I was researching, so I was lucky in that my interview was very casual. I had the job offer before I had a formal interview.
Interview Questions: I knew the person I was going to work for, my interview was very informal. I consider myself an anomaly in this sense.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I was left waiting for 20 minutes after which two people came in with no paper or pen and asked questions that were not relevant to the position I applied to. While I was waiting, i overheard the manager talking to someone on the phone and letting them know they got the job I came to interview for.
Interview Questions: What did I like the most about my cashier job I held while I was in school

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied through University of Toronto and had one group interview 3 weeks later. The group interview had about 4 different applicants and I received an offer a couple weeks later.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a group member who was not completing their assignments on time?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by PI and others in the lab. Assaying your competencies in working on the project. You had to explain your research goals and career goals, and address how they fit in with the position applied for. Interview was informative, and not a high stress situation.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in transitioning to this area of research (oncology, imaging)?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health Network
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interview - Phone and in person - typical behavioural questions
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the nurse manager of the unit I applied for. No one else was present. No HR or current employees. It took place in her office on the unit, lasted less than 30 min. Questions were valid & reasonable, I was allowed time to ask my questions a they were answered.
Interview Questions:
Why do I want to work here?
What value do I bring to the unit?
What are my goals?
Where do I see myself in 5 yrs?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited back directly by an old boss as there was no specific open posting for the job. The interview was very laid back and did not clearly indicate what my job responsibilities would be. There was also no clarity on what the reporting structure was.
Interview Questions:
What is the most challenging experience youve had working in a lab?
Do you work best alone or in a team, pros and cons for both.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a decent interview process.  Two steps involved.  First met with two team members; then met with two other team members, including the big boss. There was an opportunity to ask questions and connect with the interviewers.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UHN?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and to the point. interviewed by a panel of three clinicians and director in an office. seemed casual an informal. then had a second interview with another director.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was straightforward and timely. I did not come across any surprise questions or difficult situations. No behavioural scenarios were introduced. However, a proper job description was not provided.
Interview Questions: Very standard interview. No surprise questions

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Usually situational based and project related questions. Some leadership related ones as well. Big on Project Management.

eg. How do you feel your previous academic experience will benefit you in the role for which
     you are applying?

Describe the last time you set yourself a goal or made a commitment where you were
unable to meet the deadline.
Interview Questions: Talk about your strengths, weaknesses.

title: Strategic Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Saint John, NB) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview followed by in-person interview by senior managers. I was flown to Saint John from Ontario once both parties believed this to be a promising fit. Both interviews were friendly and relaxed and I met many managers and senior leaders for one on one conversations. The job I was ultimately offered was not perceisely the one that was advertised. It was much better. Very happy that I pursued a position in this hospital.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your educational backgound and experience and how they prepared you for this position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was referred by a fellow employee.
Got called about a month later for an interview, which was an informal chat with the would-be PI - the offer came through about  2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: What expertise do you bring to this project?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with investigators. The whole process was straightforward with somewhat predictable questions. Overall, it was a pleasant experience without too much stress. Quite a few questions were related to the job, i.e. research experiences, techniques and academic background. The whole process took about half an hour in a research lab.
Interview Questions: qualifications, past experiences

title: Senior Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening by SIMS HR team, followed by a minimum of 2 sets of interviews. Each interview includes 2 interviewers at levels more senior than the position you are applying to. Each interview is managed by the hiring manager on the team so some processes may be more fluid than others, depending on how quick/slow the hiring manager is.
Interview Questions: Typical behaviourial interview questions. Some case interview style questions depending on the role (likely only for internal applicants)

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was relaxing.  The interviewer didn't try to throw millions of technical questions.  He just wanted to talk about my previous experience and what types of projects I was involved in.  After a brief discussion about myself, he explained the description of the role and how it fits to the organization.
Interview Questions: Talk about your previous work experience

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: one panel interview with entire team. HR not at interview. Wanted to know about experience (as expected) and described role and asked questions about what I thought I could bring to it. No behavioural questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health Network (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Went over resume. Discussed what kinds of tasks would be required of me. Very informal process. Questions about my qualifications but no behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health Network in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: applied on-line and was called about 2 weeks later.  The interview was conducted with three people and a standard set of approx 10-15 questions.  The standard questions of why do you want to work here, give an example of a project that didn't go well and what did you do, give an example of someone you had a conflict with and what did you do, give an example of project management and communication.  What would your colleagues say is your strength and what would they say you could improve on.  People were young and looking for the right personality fit.
Interview Questions: What would you like to avoid in regards to your job?
